name: Hurricane Katrina
source: Official post-incident reports (President's report, FEMA, Congress), Wikipedia Timeline of Hurricane Katrina

timeline.event: Katrina reaches Category 4 (145 mph)
Category 5; NHC warns of devastating damage
Mandatory evacuation ordered for New Orleans
Superdome opened as refuge of last resort (~20k people)
Industrial Canal levees fail (I-10 bridge); storm surge enters
Power lost in Superdome
Katrina second landfall near Buras, LA (Category 3)
Power lost across much of New Orleans
Industrial Canal eastern breach; 20 ft water into Lower Ninth Ward
NWS Flash Flood Warning: levee breach Industrial Canal, 3–8 ft water
Twenty-foot tidal surge reported to FEMA regional office
6–8 feet water in Lower Ninth Ward
TSA reports Industrial Canal levee breach
London Avenue Canal breach (Gentilly)
17th Street Canal breach; London Avenue western breach
17th Street Canal breach reported to FEMA (Michael Heath)
New Orleans officials confirm 17th Street Canal breach
Chertoff learns levees cannot be plugged; evacuation of city ordered
Sandbag plan for 17th Street breach fails; 85% city underwater
Red Cross requests 300k meals; FEMA cancels order
National Guard deployed with clear authority
Red Cross meals delivered (37 days after request)

coordination_steps_traditional: Multiple approval signatures and data processing steps
Paperwork and form completions hindered immediate action
Red Cross / FEMA coordination breakdown on supply orders
quotes: Numerous time consuming approval signatures and data processing steps prior to any action, delaying the response.
Poor operational coordination generated a weak Federal performance.
munin_counterfactual: Pre-simulated hurricane/evacuation playbooks; Byzantine multi-agency sign-off in minutes; pre-positioned resources activated before landfall.
